text: Demon souls really had some of the best melancholic music in the souls series... so charming so incredibly eerie, good stuff. i like to be punished and gets ridiculed!
author: K.Nielsen

text: Great game! Really awesome boss themes, too.
author: Mortyee

text:
I tried to play this game after getting really into Dark Souls 1. The online was dead and the game did seem more unfair than Dark Souls at times (bridge dragons, world tendecies, half HP on death...) but nothing too bad. And then the Dragon God showed up and after completing the whole world without dying once it felt like an even more terrible Bed of Chaos.

I didn't really like the linear world design either.

So yeah, no online, that bullshit boss, I didn't really get into this game as I'd hoped I would. It still has its own merit but I just can't understand people saying that it's better than Dark Souls 1. I guess it depends on which game you play first...

author: Aristotle47

text: I'm playing this game right now, I just finished Tower of Latria and it quickly became one of my favorite places in the Souls series (I haven't played Dark Souls 2 yet). I'm at the Old Hero boss now, tried it once and got wrecked. He doesn't seem too hard, but reaching him is the painful part. Bloodborne is the reason I'll have to buy a PS4, it looks like an awesome evolution of the Souls games. There's also Lords of the Fallen which looks like a Souls clone made by Witcher 2's producer, I'll gladly play it once it comes out.

author: Hatt Hanz

text:
@Puddimans 4-3 is pretty epic,too,but 5-3 is still the best fight in the series.

As for DS2,I consider it a significant step backward in terms of level design,world building as well as enemey and boss design.
author: Boddy

text: Demon's souls is the best of the souls games in the atmosphere department. 4-2 (the level leading to the old hero) is the worst designed level in the game, really long and tough with no shortcuts to help keep your progress. The boss fight after the old hero is one of my favorites though so it's worth the slog through 4-2. A tip for the old hero is that he can't see very well, so doing a single attack then running away and getting behind him works well. The thief ring also makes the old hero fight much easier.

author: Sunny Rustles

text: @***** Personally, I think that DS2 is a good game, but not as enjoyable as DS1. It took several steps forward (enemy variety, weapons and their movesets are improved, etc.) but then at the same time took some steps back (soul memory, removing the idea of builds for PvP, the fact you can get stunlocked when you are in heavy armor).
